contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Radio station | name = XHPRS-FM | image = | city = [[Tecate, Baja California]] | area = [[Tijuana-San Diego metropolitan area]] | branding = 105.7 The Walrus | slogan = ''Good Times, Greatest Hits!'' | airdate = July 9, 1990 on 92.1 MHz<br>[[2005 in radio|2005]] on 105.7 MHz<br>[[2008 in radio|April 15, 2008]] with their current format| | frequency = 105.7 ([[Megahertz|MHz]]) | format = [[Oldies]]/[[Classic Hits]] | power = | erp = 8,200 [[watt]]s | haat = 781.5 meters | sister_stations = [[XEPRS-AM|XEPRS]], [[XEPE-AM|XEPE]] | | class = C1 | facility_id = 163371 | callsign_meaning = Derived from sister station [[XEPRS-AM|XEPRS]] | former_callsigns = XHBCE | owner = [[Broadcast Company of the Americas|Local Media of America]] <br>''(license and transmitter owned by a Mexican company)'' | licensee = | webcast = [http://player.streamtheworld.com/liveplayer.php?CALLSIGN=XPRSFM Listen Live] | website = {{official|http://www.walrusfm.com/ 105.7 The Walrus}} }} '''XHPRS-FM''' or '''105.7 The Walrus''' is a commercial [[Classic Hits]] and [[Oldies]] [[radio station]] in [[Tecate, Baja California]], broadcasting to the [[Tijuana-San Diego metropolitan area]] on 105.7 [[Frequency Modulation|FM]]. From [[2006 in radio|2006]] to [[2008 in radio|2008]], this station [[simulcast]]ed [[XEPRS-AM]] as ''XX'' (pronounced ''Double X'') ''Sports Radio''. It aired [[San Diego Padres]] games and the entire talk show lineup from the AM station. Before that, it had various musical formats. When XX Sports Radio aired on FM, it helped spread the XEPRS signal to eastern parts of [[San Diego County]]. ==External links== *[http://www.walrusfm.com Official website] *{{Facebook|walrusfm|105.7 The Walrus}} *{{Twitter|walrusfm|105.7 The Walrus}} {{Tijuana Radio}} {{coord missing|Mexico}} [[Category:Radio stations in Baja California]] [[Category:Oldies radio stations]] [[Category:Media in Tecate]]
